metadata.title: CVE-2020-10742 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. An index buffer overflow duringDirect IO write leading to the NFS client to crash. In some cases, a reachout of the index after one memory allocation by kmalloc will cause a kernelpanic. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to dataconfidentiality and system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10742` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-lowlatency - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-snapdragon - 5.4.0-9.12
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1004-kvm - 5.4.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1005-aws - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1006-azure - 5.4.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1005-gcp - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1005-oracle - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.6.0-1007-oem - 5.6.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1007-raspi - 5.4.0-1007.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-9.12').
